page.title: 01Review of Featherstone
page.content: Featherstone is a mining town in west Yorkshire,west of Pontefract and built as a linear settlement along the B6421.In 1971 it had a population of 15242.There have been 2 coal mines in the town,Featherstone main colliery which was closed after the 1926 strike and the Ackton Hall colliery closed July 4th.1985 following the recent pit strike.Coal is still being produced from an opencast site. Featherstone is famous for the Rovers Rugby League team which is manned by local lads many of them mine workers. There have been urban renewal and housing improvement schemes,but there have been few miners coming into the town from outside areas. North Featherstone and Ackton are villages which have grown with estates being built there.
